headline: Watch: GOP Ohio Senate Race Heats Up With Near On-Stage Brawl Between Gibbons and Mandel
author: Rick Moran
sentences:
“You’re dealing with the wrong guy,” Mandel says to Gibbons before calling him a “pussy.” pic.twitter.com/AbbyQpwXvu
— Natalie Allison (@natalie_allison) March 18, 2022
Gibbons immediately tried to make political hay out of the tussle, calling Mandel “unfit” and “childlike.”
Josh Mandel is unhinged, unfit, and flailing – because he’s losing.

Former Ohio Republican Party Chair Jane Timken, also running in the Senate primary, echoed Vance’s verdict, calling the event “embarrassing.” Matt Dolan, another GOP candidate, said Ohio voters deserved better.
The two candidates are running neck and neck in the polls for the Ohio GOP Senate nomination, and both candidates are vying for the attention and endorsement of former president Donald Trump.
The Republicans in Ohio staged a debate on Friday night that proved to be a typically boring affair until businessman Mike Gibbons and Ohio State Treasurer Josh Mandel almost came to blows.

#OHSen pic.twitter.com/xLgdca7gxR
— Mike Gibbons (@MikeGibbonsOH) March 18, 2022
The other candidates all agreed that the display reflected poorly on the entire Republican Party.

“It was embarrassing, especially for those involved, ” Vance said “I think it was embarrassing for the whole party.”
Mandel came off looking the worst, Vance said.
And Trump is keeping his powder dry as the spectacle of Mandel, Gibbons, and Vance all trying to out-Trump Trump to gain his endorsement is dominating the race.
He claimed that Gibbons had made millions from business dealings with Chinese companies while moving several of his businesses offshore, costing Americans jobs.
A straw poll of the 400 people in the audience taken immediately after the debate from FreedomWorks showed Mandel coming in last out of five with 5%.

Cincinnati.com:
The confrontation between Gibbons and Mandel doesn’t reflect well on the Republican Party, Vance told The Enquirer on Saturday.
“You may not understand this,” Gibbons told Mandel, who then stood up from his seat and confronted Gibbons at the event hosted by FreedomWorks.
As Mandel was taking his seat, Gibbons said, “You don’t know squat,” prompting Mandel to rise from his seat again.
We need an adult in the room and Josh Mandel has proven that he is not capable of being that for Ohioans.
“You have never … you have never been in the private sector in your entire life,” Gibbons told Mandel.
So when Gibbons accused Mandel of never having been in the private sector, Mandel took offense.

Gibbons then told Mandel to “back off.”
This is not an episode of Jerry Springer.
Don’t tell me I haven’t worked,” Mandel responded, raising his voice to Gibbons.
Rob Portman has endorsed Timken, but that apparently hasn’t helped her campaign.
“America is in crisis and we need adult leadership,” he said in a statement.
A moderator approached the two men and attempted to defuse the situation.
The race is as much about Trump as it is anything else.
We can’t leave this race to child-like candidates.
The confrontation did neither candidate any good.
It’s tonight’s Ohio Republican Senate debate.
And that’s just how Trump wants it.
Gibbons came in third with 16%.
“I do,” Mandel replied.
“Two tours in Iraq.
The retiring Sen.
